intro: Petasites albus var. ramosus, commonly known as the white buttercup or white crown imperial, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its large, white, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a stout, fleshy rhizome and produces compound leaves with a distinctive, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
